thread.title: Antidepressant drug Paxil not safe for teenagers, The New York Times reports
thread.title_full: Antidepressant drug Paxil not safe for teenagers, The New York Times reports | NOLA.com

author: Littice Bacon-Blood, NOLA.com | The Times-Picayune
title: Antidepressant drug Paxil not safe for teenagers, The New York Times reports
text:
A new look at a 2001 study conducted on the use of the antidepressant drug Paxil indicates the drug is not safe for teenagers, according to The New York Times.
The reanalysis contradicts the results touted by the drug company 14 years ago that said the drug was safe and effective for teenagers, the newspaper reports.
Authors of the new study, which was published last week in the medical journal BMJ, said adverse reactions to the drugs, such as suicidal thoughts and behaviors, were mislabeled in the original study.
 Read The New York Times full story.
